help.description:
Displays a comprehensive help interface for giteo-server.
	It provides detailed information about the available commands, their usage, and examples,
	helping users understand how to operate the server efficiently.

setup.description:
Runs the setup procedure to initialize the system for giteo-server.
	This command ensures that all necessary configurations, directories,
	and default files are properly created, allowing the server to function correctly on your machine.

adduser.description:
This command registers a new account in the server's configuration database, initializes the userâ€™s directory structure, and prepares the workspace according to your server policies.
It ensures the user is properly integrated into the permission system and ready to interact with repositories managed by giteo-server.
Use this command whenever you want to create a new contributor with access to your local Git environment.

removeuser.description:
This command deletes the targeted user from the internal database, revokes all associated permissions, and ensures the account no longer has access to repositories managed by giteo-server.
Optionally, depending on your server's configuration, associated user data or directories may be cleaned up.
Use this command to safely deauthorize a user from the local Git environment.
